instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-0016: What is 820-0016? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PM_BATLOW_L: What is PM_BATLOW_L? PM_BATLOW_L is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on, when it is low. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MISSING <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Good day guys

am currently busy on a board, and I am struggling to get the <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> signal, I have replaced the known good SMC but no changes, the same SMC works okay on a different board and I get <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL>, but on this board, I don't have it, other SMC output signals are present and my ppbus voltage is properly regulated by the SMC too. I checked for a short to ground and there's non, is there somewhere I need to check for this signal? without the signal being created, am unable to move forward, please help.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MISSING <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message: What wattage charger are you using ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MISSING <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Be sure to use original Magsafe 2 charger; no matters 45-85W.

Do you get amber light and battery is charging?
Steady <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>/SUS?
Check <RESISTOR>R1410</RESISTOR>...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MISSING <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MISSING <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message: [USER=682]@2informaticos[/USER], <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>/SUS is steady, <RESISTOR>R1410</RESISTOR> has 3.3V on pin 1 but less than 1V on pin 2, when I disconnect the resistor from the <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> line , i got 3.3V and there's no short to ground

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MISSING <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Did you check if <RESISTOR>R1410</RESISTOR> has correct ohm value???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MISSING <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message: [USER=682]@2informaticos[/USER] yes <RESISTOR>R1410</RESISTOR> has the correct value, compared to a known working board

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MISSING <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
"Do you get amber light and battery is charging?"

Try to start with charger and battery, both connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MISSING <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message: I get the amber light, I tried to start the machine with charger and battery but no changes.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MISSING <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Thank you guys, I apologize, for my mistakes, when [USER=682]@2informaticos[/USER] asked this  (<SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>/SUS is steady)  I did check but did not hold the probe point longer to see that after sometimes the voltage drops and then go back up, so I resolved that, and the board is now resolved.
Thank you so much [USER=682]@2informaticos[/USER] and [USER=461]@Gurmon[/USER].
